trans-unit.source: Execute R Script
trans-unit.target: Execute R Script

trans-unit.source: Executes an R script from an Azure Machine Learning experiment
trans-unit.target: Executes an R script from an Azure Machine Learning experiment

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="D42F7C08-039B-4F91-809D-AA138FCCF254" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">R Language Modules</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="D42F7C08-039B-4F91-809D-AA138FCCF254" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">R Language Modules</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to embed R code into experiments in Azure Machine Learning and execute them using R 3.1.0.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to embed R code into experiments in Azure Machine Learning and execute them using R 3.1.0.

trans-unit.source: By adding R code to this module, you can perform a variety of customized tasks that are not available in Studio, including:
trans-unit.target: By adding R code to this module, you can perform a variety of customized tasks that are not available in Studio, including:

trans-unit.source: Create custom data transformations
trans-unit.target: Create custom data transformations

trans-unit.source: Make your own metrics for evaluating predictions
trans-unit.target: Make your own metrics for evaluating predictions

trans-unit.source: Build models using algorithms that are not implemented as standalone modules in Studio
trans-unit.target: Build models using algorithms that are not implemented as standalone modules in Studio

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module contains sample R code that can be used as a template for developing new code.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module contains sample R code that can be used as a template for developing new code.

trans-unit.source: R code that runs in other tools, such as R Studio, might need small changes to run it in Studio.
trans-unit.target: R code that runs in other tools, such as R Studio, might need small changes to run it in Studio.

trans-unit.source: For example, input data that you provide in CSV format must be explicitly converted to a dataset before you can use it in your code.
trans-unit.target: For example, input data that you provide in CSV format must be explicitly converted to a dataset before you can use it in your code.

trans-unit.source: The data and column types used in the R language are not exactly the same as the data and column types used in Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: The data and column types used in the R language are not exactly the same as the data and column types used in Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: For details, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Conversion" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.
trans-unit.target: For details, see the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Conversion" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Technical Notes</legacyLink> section.

trans-unit.source: R Packages Available in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: R Packages Available in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: The R environment in Azure Machine Learning has over 400 R packages installed.
trans-unit.target: The R environment in Azure Machine Learning has over 400 R packages installed.

trans-unit.source: To get a list of installed packages as a dataset, run the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module with the following R code:
trans-unit.target: To get a list of installed packages as a dataset, run the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module with the following R code:

trans-unit.source: How to Use Execute R Script
trans-unit.target: How to Use Execute R Script

trans-unit.source: To configure the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, you provide a set of optional inputs and the R code that is to be run in the workspace.
trans-unit.target: To configure the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, you provide a set of optional inputs and the R code that is to be run in the workspace.

trans-unit.source: Inputs
trans-unit.target: Inputs

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module supports the following inputs:
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module supports the following inputs:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Dataset1</ui>: Attach an optional input dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Dataset1</ui>: Attach an optional input dataset.

trans-unit.source: The input dataset should be in CSV, TSV, ARFF, or the internal Dataset format.
trans-unit.target: The input dataset should be in CSV, TSV, ARFF, or the internal Dataset format.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Dataset2</ui>: Attach a second optional input dataset.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Dataset2</ui>: Attach a second optional input dataset.

trans-unit.source: The input dataset should be in CSV, TSV, ARFF, or the internal Dataset format.
trans-unit.target: The input dataset should be in CSV, TSV, ARFF, or the internal Dataset format.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Script Bundle</ui>: Specify an optional ZIP file that can include additional R code, R objects, R packages, and datasets.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Script Bundle</ui>: Specify an optional ZIP file that can include additional R code, R objects, R packages, and datasets.

trans-unit.source: Before you can configure the <ui>Script Bundle</ui> input, the ZIP file must be present in the Studio workspace.
trans-unit.target: Before you can configure the <ui>Script Bundle</ui> input, the ZIP file must be present in the Studio workspace.

trans-unit.source: To upload a ZIP file to your workspace, click <ui>New</ui>, click <ui>Dataset</ui>, and then select <ui>From local file</ui> and the <ui>Zip file</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: To upload a ZIP file to your workspace, click <ui>New</ui>, click <ui>Dataset</ui>, and then select <ui>From local file</ui> and the <ui>Zip file</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: After you have uploaded the zipped package to Studio, verify that the zipped file is available in the <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> list, and then connect the dataset to the <ui>Script Bundle</ui> input port.
trans-unit.target: After you have uploaded the zipped package to Studio, verify that the zipped file is available in the <ui>Saved Datasets</ui> list, and then connect the dataset to the <ui>Script Bundle</ui> input port.

trans-unit.source: If your zipped file contains an R package, you need to install the R package as part of the custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: If your zipped file contains an R package, you need to install the R package as part of the custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: Any file that was contained in your ZIP file will be available for use during run time.
trans-unit.target: Any file that was contained in your ZIP file will be available for use during run time.

trans-unit.source: If there was a directory structure present, it will be preserved.
trans-unit.target: If there was a directory structure present, it will be preserved.

trans-unit.source: The only change is that you must prepend a directory called <system>src</system> to the path.
trans-unit.target: The only change is that you must prepend a directory called <system>src</system> to the path.

trans-unit.source: Typically, R packages are provided as downloadable ZIP files.
trans-unit.target: Typically, R packages are provided as downloadable ZIP files.

trans-unit.source: If you have already downloaded and extracted the R package that you are using in your code, you will need to re-zip the package or include the original ZIP file before you can upload the R package to Studio.
trans-unit.target: If you have already downloaded and extracted the R package that you are using in your code, you will need to re-zip the package or include the original ZIP file before you can upload the R package to Studio.

trans-unit.source: Outputs
trans-unit.target: Outputs

trans-unit.source: This module returns the following outputs:
trans-unit.target: This module returns the following outputs:

trans-unit.source: <ui>Results Dataset</ui>: Provides a dataset that contains the results of any computations performed by the embedded R code.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Results Dataset</ui>: Provides a dataset that contains the results of any computations performed by the embedded R code.

trans-unit.source: The dataset uses the internal <link xlink:href="285668ca-bd74-42b2-9c2c-3111b4819e56" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DataTable</link> format.
trans-unit.target: The dataset uses the internal <link xlink:href="285668ca-bd74-42b2-9c2c-3111b4819e56" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">DataTable</link> format.

trans-unit.source: On this output, you can return only objects where <codeInline>is.data.frame</codeInline> is true.
trans-unit.target: On this output, you can return only objects where <codeInline>is.data.frame</codeInline> is true.

trans-unit.source: To return other R objects, try serializing the object into a byte array, or use a function that returns the desired data as a <languageKeyword>data.frame</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: To return other R objects, try serializing the object into a byte array, or use a function that returns the desired data as a <languageKeyword>data.frame</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: <ui>R Device</ui>: Supports console output and display of PNG graphics using the R interpreter.
trans-unit.target: <ui>R Device</ui>: Supports console output and display of PNG graphics using the R interpreter.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
trans-unit.target: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module supports customization by using embedded R script.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module supports customization by using embedded R script.

trans-unit.source: R Script
trans-unit.target: R Script

trans-unit.source: You type R script into the <ui>R Script</ui> text box.
trans-unit.target: You type R script into the <ui>R Script</ui> text box.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>R Script</ui> text box is prepopulated with the following sample code, which you can edit or replace.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>R Script</ui> text box is prepopulated with the following sample code, which you can edit or replace.

trans-unit.source: Random Seed
trans-unit.target: Random Seed

trans-unit.source: Define a random seed value for use inside the R environment.
trans-unit.target: Define a random seed value for use inside the R environment.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is equivalent to calling <codeInline>set.seed(value)</codeInline> in R code.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is equivalent to calling <codeInline>set.seed(value)</codeInline> in R code.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: You can see examples of how this module is used by exploring these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Student Performance sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> uses custom R script to combine the results of evaluations for multiple models into a single dataset.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Student Performance sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525727</linkUri></externalLink> uses custom R script to combine the results of evaluations for multiple models into a single dataset.

trans-unit.source: This sample also uses R code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to compute 16 time-dependent columns.
trans-unit.target: This sample also uses R code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to compute 16 time-dependent columns.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Breast Cancer sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525726</linkUri></externalLink> uses custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to replicate positive examples and to combine metrics.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Breast Cancer sample</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525726</linkUri></externalLink> uses custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to replicate positive examples and to combine metrics.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Time Series Forecasting</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525273</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Execute R Script</ui> to generate custom metrics, and then combines them into a single table by using the <link xlink:href="b2ebdabd-217d-4915-86cc-5b05972f7270" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Rows</link> module.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Time Series Forecasting</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525273</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Execute R Script</ui> to generate custom metrics, and then combines them into a single table by using the <link xlink:href="b2ebdabd-217d-4915-86cc-5b05972f7270" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Rows</link> module.

trans-unit.source: There are many ways that you can extend your experiment by using custom R script.
trans-unit.target: There are many ways that you can extend your experiment by using custom R script.

trans-unit.source: To get started using R in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, see this video: <externalLink><linkText>Using R in Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Blogs/Windows-Azure/R-in-Azure-ML-Studio</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: To get started using R in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, see this video: <externalLink><linkText>Using R in Azure Machine Learning Studio</linkText><linkUri>http://channel9.msdn.com/Blogs/Windows-Azure/R-in-Azure-ML-Studio</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: This following sections provide simple walkthroughs that demonstrate common scenarios for use of custom R code, including reading files, manipulating data, writing graphics files, and using custom learners.
trans-unit.target: This following sections provide simple walkthroughs that demonstrate common scenarios for use of custom R code, including reading files, manipulating data, writing graphics files, and using custom learners.

trans-unit.source: Reading from Input and Writing to Output
trans-unit.target: Reading from Input and Writing to Output

trans-unit.source: The following script takes the input table and appends a copy of the table to itself, effectively doubling the size of the table.
trans-unit.target: The following script takes the input table and appends a copy of the table to itself, effectively doubling the size of the table.

trans-unit.source: The result is then sent to the output port.
trans-unit.target: The result is then sent to the output port.

trans-unit.source: Reading a ZIP File as Input
trans-unit.target: Reading a ZIP File as Input

trans-unit.source: This scenario assumes that you have uploaded a data file in CSV format, named “mydatafile.csv”, as part of your ZIP file.
trans-unit.target: This scenario assumes that you have uploaded a data file in CSV format, named “mydatafile.csv”, as part of your ZIP file.

trans-unit.source: Next, you connected the resulting dataset to the <ui>ScriptBundle</ui> input of your <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: Next, you connected the resulting dataset to the <ui>ScriptBundle</ui> input of your <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: Using the following code, you can read a CSV data from the ZIP file as a dataset as part of processing in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: Using the following code, you can read a CSV data from the ZIP file as a dataset as part of processing in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: If you pass an existing dataset to <ui>Execute R Script</ui>, the underlying Data Table format will be passed to your R function in the <codeInline>data.frame</codeInline> format.
trans-unit.target: If you pass an existing dataset to <ui>Execute R Script</ui>, the underlying Data Table format will be passed to your R function in the <codeInline>data.frame</codeInline> format.

trans-unit.source: Any other data that is compatible with the Data Table format (CSV files, ARFF files, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Any other data that is compatible with the Data Table format (CSV files, ARFF files, etc.)

trans-unit.source: will be automatically converted to the <codeInline>data.frame</codeInline> format.
trans-unit.target: will be automatically converted to the <codeInline>data.frame</codeInline> format.

trans-unit.source: Replicate Rows
trans-unit.target: Replicate Rows

trans-unit.source: In R, replicating rows is easy.
trans-unit.target: In R, replicating rows is easy.

trans-unit.source: This example demonstrates how you can replicate the positive samples in a dataset by a factor of 20 to balance the sample.
trans-unit.target: This example demonstrates how you can replicate the positive samples in a dataset by a factor of 20 to balance the sample.

trans-unit.source: Call a Custom Learner – R Arules Package
trans-unit.target: Call a Custom Learner – R Arules Package

trans-unit.source: This example calls a learner that implements the <legacyItalic>a priori</legacyItalic> association rules algorithm provided by the R language package <languageKeyword>Arules</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This example calls a learner that implements the <legacyItalic>a priori</legacyItalic> association rules algorithm provided by the R language package <languageKeyword>Arules</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The learner is then used in a market basket analysis task.
trans-unit.target: The learner is then used in a market basket analysis task.

trans-unit.source: Call a Custom Learner – Naïve Bayes
trans-unit.target: Call a Custom Learner – Naïve Bayes

trans-unit.source: The following code illustrates how you can call an R library to build a model by using a machine learning algorithm that is not included in Studio.
trans-unit.target: The following code illustrates how you can call an R library to build a model by using a machine learning algorithm that is not included in Studio.

trans-unit.source: This example implements a Naïve Bayes learner provided by the R <languageKeyword>e1071</languageKeyword> library.
trans-unit.target: This example implements a Naïve Bayes learner provided by the R <languageKeyword>e1071</languageKeyword> library.

trans-unit.source: Create a Custom Scorer
trans-unit.target: Create a Custom Scorer

trans-unit.source: The following code demonstrates how you can call a scorer from an existing R library by using custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: The following code demonstrates how you can call a scorer from an existing R library by using custom code in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: Write a Graphics File
trans-unit.target: Write a Graphics File

trans-unit.source: Suppose you are running an experiment that uses <ui>Execute R Script</ui> and your script generates a chart as a PDF file.
trans-unit.target: Suppose you are running an experiment that uses <ui>Execute R Script</ui> and your script generates a chart as a PDF file.

trans-unit.source: Although Studio supports the display of PNG files using the <ui>R Device</ui> output port, you might want to generate the results as a PDF file in a blob in Azure Storage to use for reporting.
trans-unit.target: Although Studio supports the display of PNG files using the <ui>R Device</ui> output port, you might want to generate the results as a PDF file in a blob in Azure Storage to use for reporting.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you can create the basic PDF file, and then use your <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to return the Base64-encoded string of the PDF file.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you can create the basic PDF file, and then use your <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to return the Base64-encoded string of the PDF file.

trans-unit.source: You can then pass this output to a <link xlink:href="7a391181-b6a7-4ad4-b82d-e419c0d6522c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writer</link> module, which can send the value to a blob.
trans-unit.target: You can then pass this output to a <link xlink:href="7a391181-b6a7-4ad4-b82d-e419c0d6522c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writer</link> module, which can send the value to a blob.

trans-unit.source: The following code illustrates this approach:
trans-unit.target: The following code illustrates this approach:

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: Optimizing R Performance in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: Optimizing R Performance in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: The current default memory is 14 GB.
trans-unit.target: The current default memory is 14 GB.

trans-unit.source: You might encounter an out-of-memory error message if you attempt to manipulate very large data frames by using the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.
trans-unit.target: You might encounter an out-of-memory error message if you attempt to manipulate very large data frames by using the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module.

trans-unit.source: To increase the amount of memory that is used by R script, you can use a line similar to this at the beginning of the script:
trans-unit.target: To increase the amount of memory that is used by R script, you can use a line similar to this at the beginning of the script:

trans-unit.source: User-specified R code is run by a 64-bit R interpreter (version 3.1.0) that runs in Azure using an A8 virtual machine with 56 GB of RAM.
trans-unit.target: User-specified R code is run by a 64-bit R interpreter (version 3.1.0) that runs in Azure using an A8 virtual machine with 56 GB of RAM.

trans-unit.source: To increases the speed of your R code, you can use the just-in-time compiler provided in the preinstalled <ui>Compiler</ui> package.
trans-unit.target: To increases the speed of your R code, you can use the just-in-time compiler provided in the preinstalled <ui>Compiler</ui> package.

trans-unit.source: Converting Column Data Types Between R and Studio
trans-unit.target: Converting Column Data Types Between R and Studio

trans-unit.source: The following table shows how the data types in R correspond to the data types in Azure Machine Learning:
trans-unit.target: The following table shows how the data types in R correspond to the data types in Azure Machine Learning:

trans-unit.source: R type
trans-unit.target: R type

trans-unit.source: Studio type
trans-unit.target: Studio type

trans-unit.source: Integer
trans-unit.target: Integer

trans-unit.source: Integer
trans-unit.target: Integer

trans-unit.source: Double
trans-unit.target: Double

trans-unit.source: Double
trans-unit.target: Double

trans-unit.source: Complex
trans-unit.target: Complex

trans-unit.source: Complex
trans-unit.target: Complex

trans-unit.source: This type is supported by only a subset of modules.
trans-unit.target: This type is supported by only a subset of modules.

trans-unit.source: Logical
trans-unit.target: Logical

trans-unit.source: Boolean
trans-unit.target: Boolean

trans-unit.source: Character
trans-unit.target: Character

trans-unit.source: String
trans-unit.target: String

trans-unit.source: Raw
trans-unit.target: Raw

trans-unit.source: Not supported
trans-unit.target: Not supported

trans-unit.source: Difftime
trans-unit.target: Difftime

trans-unit.source: TimeSpan
trans-unit.target: TimeSpan

trans-unit.source: factor
trans-unit.target: factor

trans-unit.source: categorical
trans-unit.target: categorical

trans-unit.source: data.frame
trans-unit.target: data.frame

trans-unit.source: dataset
trans-unit.target: dataset

trans-unit.source: Columns of data type <languageKeyword>lists</languageKeyword> in R cannot be converted because the elements in such columns potentially are of different types and sizes.
trans-unit.target: Columns of data type <languageKeyword>lists</languageKeyword> in R cannot be converted because the elements in such columns potentially are of different types and sizes.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following valid R code will fail if used in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following valid R code will fail if used in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module:

trans-unit.source: Converting DateTime Values
trans-unit.target: Converting DateTime Values

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Studio uses different datetime types than does R. If the data that you are analyzing contains date or time data, you should be aware of the following conversion requirements when porting existing R code into Studio:
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Studio uses different datetime types than does R. If the data that you are analyzing contains date or time data, you should be aware of the following conversion requirements when porting existing R code into Studio:

trans-unit.source: To convert from Azure Machine Learning Studio to R:
trans-unit.target: To convert from Azure Machine Learning Studio to R:

trans-unit.source: DateTime columns are converted to POSIXct vectors.
trans-unit.target: DateTime columns are converted to POSIXct vectors.

trans-unit.source: However, each individual element of the resulting vector is a number of seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.
trans-unit.target: However, each individual element of the resulting vector is a number of seconds since 1970-01-01T00:00:00.

trans-unit.source: No time zone adjustments are made in this conversion.
trans-unit.target: No time zone adjustments are made in this conversion.

trans-unit.source: To convert from R to Azure Machine Learning Studio:
trans-unit.target: To convert from R to Azure Machine Learning Studio:

trans-unit.source: POSIXct vectors are converted to DateTime columns in the UTC time zone.
trans-unit.target: POSIXct vectors are converted to DateTime columns in the UTC time zone.

trans-unit.source: For example, 2011-03-27 01:30:00 PDT will be converted to 2011-03-27T08:30:00Z, where the Z indicates that the time is in UTC.
trans-unit.target: For example, 2011-03-27 01:30:00 PDT will be converted to 2011-03-27T08:30:00Z, where the Z indicates that the time is in UTC.

trans-unit.source: When using times inside the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, you must specify time stamps explicitly.
trans-unit.target: When using times inside the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, you must specify time stamps explicitly.

trans-unit.source: The R interpreter hosted in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module does not have access to local time zone definitions.
trans-unit.target: The R interpreter hosted in the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module does not have access to local time zone definitions.

trans-unit.source: Passing R Objects Between Execute R Script Modules
trans-unit.target: Passing R Objects Between Execute R Script Modules

trans-unit.source: You can pass R objects between instances of the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module by using the internal serialization mechanism.
trans-unit.target: You can pass R objects between instances of the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module by using the internal serialization mechanism.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following R code demonstrates how to move the R object named <userInput>A</userInput> between two <ui>Execute R Script</ui> modules.
trans-unit.target: For example, the following R code demonstrates how to move the R object named <userInput>A</userInput> between two <ui>Execute R Script</ui> modules.

trans-unit.source: In the first <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, add the following code to create a serialized object <codeInline>A</codeInline> as a column in the module’s output Data Table:
trans-unit.target: In the first <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module, add the following code to create a serialized object <codeInline>A</codeInline> as a column in the module’s output Data Table:

trans-unit.source: The explicit conversion to integer type is required because the serialization function outputs data in the R <languageKeyword>Raw</languageKeyword> format, which is not supported by Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: The explicit conversion to integer type is required because the serialization function outputs data in the R <languageKeyword>Raw</languageKeyword> format, which is not supported by Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Use the following code in the second <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to extract object <codeInline>A</codeInline> from the input Data Table:
trans-unit.target: Use the following code in the second <ui>Execute R Script</ui> module to extract object <codeInline>A</codeInline> from the input Data Table:

trans-unit.source: Networking
trans-unit.target: Networking

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, all networking from or to R code in <ui>Execute R Script</ui> modules is blocked by Azure.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, all networking from or to R code in <ui>Execute R Script</ui> modules is blocked by Azure.

trans-unit.source: Also, with very few exceptions, access to local ports from the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> is blocked.
trans-unit.target: Also, with very few exceptions, access to local ports from the <ui>Execute R Script</ui> is blocked.

trans-unit.source: Parallel Execution
trans-unit.target: Parallel Execution

trans-unit.source: Currently parallel execution with multiple threads is not supported.
